subject: Re: newbie - installation test runs 89/90 then gives error on last test?!!?
msgSnippet: ... except ... the ... and ... then ... junit.tests does contain LoadedFromJar.class.  My classpath already includes the Junit installation directory.  I
messageBody:
--- In junit@y..., Mike Clark <mike@c...> wrote:
>
> aseelaa wrote:
>
> >Hi,
> >I am new to Junit, and I've been trying to get the sample test to
> >work to no avail (with junit 3.7). It runs all the tests OK
except
> >the last one, where it gives me the following error message:
> >----------------
> >java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: junit.tests.LoadedFromJar
> >
> > at junit.runner.TestCaseClassLoader.lookupClassData
> >(TestCaseClassLoader.java:124)
> >
> > at junit.runner.TestCaseClassLoader.loadClass
> >(TestCaseClassLoader.java:101)
> >
> > at junit.tests.TestCaseClassLoaderTest.testJarClassLoading
> >(TestCaseClassLoaderTest.java:35)
> >
> > at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
> >
> > at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
> >
> > at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown
> >Source)
> >-----------------
> >The strange thing is that all the other class that pass OK are in
the
> >same directory, telling me that my classpath is most likely set
> >correctly. The same error message pops up if I run it with awt
and
> >swing.
> >Any ideas???
> >
>
> I'd recommend inspecting the junit/tests directory to see if
> LoadedFromJar.class exists. If it does, then ensure your CLASSPATH
> includes the JUnit installation directory. If it does not exist,
then
> reinstall junit3.7.
>
> Mike

junit.tests does contain LoadedFromJar.class. My classpath already
includes the Junit installation directory. I copied code from the
refactoring book, and that works fine (in all 3 interfaces), but the
test still gives an error in the last test. I also tried running the
junit.tests.AllTests (instead of junit.samples.Alltests), and that
fails on the 63rd test (and the first 62 pass OK).
